Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is grey in section, the exterior is grooved and bears traces of a light-brown slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, smudged and faded in places, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.104)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87616) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87616)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 118 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
